case_vignette: A 5-year-old boy presents to the emergency department with a rash. The patient’s parents state that he has been more ill lately. They report that he recently developed a rash on his head that now seems to be spreading to the rest of his body. His symptoms started 3 days ago and have considerably worsened since then. The patient is otherwise healthy. He has not seen a pediatrician nor has he attended general checkup or milestone appointments. The patient’s parents have tried giving him homeopathic remedies including tuber oil to help him feel better with little success. Otherwise, the parents regularly take their child hiking and swimming in outdoor streams. His temperature is 102°F (38.9°C), blood pressure is 106/68 mmHg, pulse is 167/min, respirations are 25/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. Physical exam is notable for the finding in Figure A. The child appears very ill and confused.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got a rash on my head that's spreading to the rest of my body, and I'm feeling more sick lately.
Have you had any fever or chills?
Yes, I have a fever.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or weight?
My parents didn't mention anything about changes in my appetite or weight.
Have you had any recent exposure to any new animals or insects?
My parents take me hiking and swimming in outdoor streams, but they didn't say anything about new animals or insects.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns?
My parents haven't mentioned anything about changes in my sleep patterns.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or eating habits?
No, there have been no changes in my diet or eating habits recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your daily routine or activities?
My parents didn't mention any changes in my daily routine or activities.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
They tried giving me homeopathic remedies including tuber oil, but it didn't help much.
Have you had any recent changes in your family's medical history?
My parents haven't mentioned any recent changes in our family's medical history.
Final Diagnosis: Lyme Disease.
